alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:41AM CDT until May 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. .Water levels continue to drop across the Red Lake River, with Action stage being neared Sunday night into Monday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red Lake River at Crookston. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, EOC Committee meets to determine when to open EOC. Decision based on river level predictions and forecasted weather. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Thursday was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday evening and continue falling to 12.9 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
